# BEGIN: Read Between the Lines (Belnir's arc quest)
DM [Ricochet] BOT 25-04-2024 10:25

DM [Ricochet] BOT 25-04-2024 11:16
Though Belnir has spent much of the intervening months since the Librium‚Äôs destruction in seclusion, its loss was felt by all. Gone was that bastion of community, the pillar of shared knowledge, the quiet resistance against isolation and avarice. Barovia has long been a place without hope. So when a tiny sliver of it reaches Belnir‚Äôs ears on a secret outing to Dusklight Supply for‚Ä¶ supplies‚Ä¶ he follows it. A rumor has surfaced of a mysterious, hidden building on the slopes of Mt. Baratok. Some say it is a library. Some say a palace. None can find it when they turn around again. Most think the people who encountered it were suffering from some fever dream or other, a common plague in the land of Mists. But two accounts make a coincidence. Three make a question. Four‚Ä¶ make a lead. From the information he is able to gather, at least four people have encountered a strange human man with a long, scraggly beard in the mountains. He appears out of nowhere and invites them into a magical door for tea. They are treated to tea and cakes, then summarily jettisoned from the premises. A hidden library. A hidden anything! Could whatever is hidden there have applications on rebuilding the Librium? Only one way to find out. Belnir sends messages to his closest allies, and together, they teleport to Mt. Baratok to find hope.

The comforts within may run contrary to the dour and sad existence out in Barovia, but the rules of its temporary magic fall in favor of this dark plane's nature to return everything and everyone to ruin and despair. Avrae BOT 25-04-2024 17:09
Quincy (Belnir¬π‚Å∑) -5
Belnir's Magnificent Mansion
The portal reveals an unassuming square room constructed of smooth dark grey stone. Once inside, to the right, one can see the the singular door of the room. The walls opposite of the portal and the door sport a low shelf, that doubles as a bench, and numerous hooks to hang coats and the like. Through the door is a white marble banquet hall with a high ceiling and enough room to feed a small army. The room's wall, its dozen or so doors, and the long tables are grand Dwarven stonework but the small gardens and reading nooks that dot the periphery and the wooden furnishings follow Sylvan design. Sourceless light keeps the space well lit, an illusory touch make it look as if it was sunlight. Upon first entry from the foyer, trays gently float out from a kitchen doorway and approach Belnir and his guests. Each bearing a small assortment of drinks, including hot teas and chilled alcoholic beverages. Most of the doors lead to comfortable bedrooms, each equipped with writing desks and a small variety of chairs. A few doors have been engraved with the function they have been furnished for: Library, Workshop, Laboratory, or Infirmary.
Belnir BOT 25-04-2024 17:11
Belnir awoke earlier than usual, like he was once again a young dwarf excited to see what odd and obscure texts the carnivals of Harvest's Close have brought to Grimgolir. He is out on one the end of the dining hall of the magical mansion he summoned last night for his friends and himself to rest. He has wheeled out a corkboard from his study. Put upon it is an enlarged sketch replication of Mount Baratok from his map and the scant information he had chanced upon. Belnir has spared little detail in the finer notes, including exact transcriptions of the rumors spoken, in hopes of finding patterns in the particulars but such endeavors appear to be fruitless. *A delineated portion of the board hosts a scattering of means, concerns, and -though Belnir might not call them such- hopes for a way to fill the void of communal knowledge left by the burning of the Librium Arcanum. A few pieces, such as timing limitations of spells like Demiplane, are linked across to speculations mysterious building of Mount Baratok as possible answers to the limitations. The top of this portion is headed with the abbreviated premise: "How might we establish an enduring open library?"* As he waits for all his friends to rise and gather, Belnir eats his breakfast and contemplates how they might find this strange man and building.

Stelinar BOT 25-04-2024 17:39
The Detective slowly limps into the detective agency in Vallaki, wounded, tired. He'd just finished with whatever icy Hell had taken the town. It seemed that all of the heavy hitters were on vacation or some utter nonsense... so he and a few others had to do. He slips off his winter coat, already feeling it getting warmer now that the ice queen was dead, and that infernal dragon was gone. Looking the coat over he realizes just how much wear and tear he himself had accumulated. All at the behest of some floozy who seemed like all she was good for was being the woman who cried bear. This was going to be a "him day." Mend his wounds, fix his coat, maybe partake in a bit of actual detective work. Definitely no playing dragonslayer He smiles slightly at the idea. Then the sending from Belnir hits his mind A solid seventy-five percent of him wanted to just brush it off and "call in sick." Getting slashed and stabbed by claws several times your size was a reasonable excuse, yes? But it was Belnir... his first real friend in Barovia. He was there in the beginning, and he might very well be there in the end. He audibly groans, grabbing his winter coat and stuffing it into his bag. He'd fix it later. His foot stomps on the ground, activating his shiftweave as his regular detective attire appears on him as he procures his feather cap from his bag. He makes his way out the door, whispering softly to a small key in his palm as the arcane lock does its work He tries to clean up as best as he can on the way, along with a pitch of diamond dust over himself Non-Detection However once he arrives it is clear it has been a bit of a week for him, as he enters the space between spaces that his friend had conjured out in the middle of nowhere and therewhere "If you mention a dragon Belnir I'm walking right back out that door. I'm still getting feeling back in my fingers." He says bluntly though in a light hearted tone

Korvin BOT 25-04-2024 19:02
Korvin wakes in Belnir's mansion, for once fully rested. Divinations could not be used as an excuse to stay up late as his night was spent away from the laboratorium's corpses. Furthermore, the lavish dwarf sized bed he slept on was a vast improved to a small cot pushed against a corner in the morgue. He stretches and takes care of necessities, his copy cleaning him with a quick cast of presdigitation. Once biological needs are met, Korvin takes care of the arcane, selecting spells for to keep him alive Balancing his selections against the frozen spell list of his copy. As bloodshed is so common in these lands, Korvin prepares spells fit for combat, relying on his chronicle and scrolls for utility. When finally ready, the mage and his copy step out of the room Belnir has provided and meets his colleague near the blackboard, his eyes and that of his copies taking in what is written. Establishing a library was the concern of this gathering. A library that would not serve as a gathering place for insurrectionists, but offer a means to collect and distribute knowledge. That was the goal of the previous librium until it became no more than a common conference room. They thought a simple enduring spellbook amidst a collection of mundane volumes would suffice. This time Korvin would ensure proper security before committing any of his shared knowledge to this collection. "You believe now is the time to resurrect a library in Barovia?" Korvin asks Belnir.

While I cannot prove that the sightings have a high chance of ceasing soon, I have experience with and study of fickle beings such as fey that I am hedging my bets on. If he or his magic has the fickle tendencies I suspect, this particular mountain on this particular plane may tickle the bearded man's fancy today, but the chances of that changing rapidly increase with each passing day." Belnir pauses after making his points. His response felt... tainted with reflex, he reconsiders outside the academic framework "I have more arguments of the value to doing this but I am no being of pure logic. You all may consider this a favor that I am asking of you." His head bows slightly as he continues, perhaps in humility or shame "I have been preparing and hiding for a long while now, but I feel that it will all come to a head soon. If I am to truly die or depart Barovia for good, I want to leave a lasting impact of good -something that isn't lost if a small handful of books and mages are destroyed."

DM [Ricochet] BOT 04-06-2024 23:16
The book in question -- 'Not Just Psionics: A Comprehensive Guide to Identifying Magical Maladies' -- has extensive descriptions of the symptomatology of various spells. Korvin, being a practitioner of both the arcane and, specifically, healing arts, is familiar with nearly all of them. In passing, at the very least. The book has a final chapter on such ailments, citing studies on patients who were either repeat victims of powerful mind-altering enchantments or, more insidious, were suffering from underlying or parallel ailments that stemmed from more intrinsic sources rather than magical ones. Natural, intellectual, or social catalysts are cited as possibilities, and treatment options range from a self-care regimen to extensive therapies involving close friends and family, but the author admits to having limited expertise on such non-magical treatments.
